decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with hate cards like Void Mirror and Chancellor of the Annex. The goal is to apply pressure on the opponent while also preventing them from efficiently casting spells. The inclusion of cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Clarion Conqueror helps keep the opponent's board in check, allowing the deck to maintain control of the game. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful creatures, this deck aims to establish dominance early on and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on using Gifts Ungiven to tutor for key spells and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counter magic. It also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Brain Freeze and Underworld Breach for alternative win conditions. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of resilience and value to the deck. The control aspect of the deck is supplemented by a variety of powerful mana rocks and card draw spells, making it a versatile and potent force in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategies with counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker. The goal is to utilize card advantage and efficient spells to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game. The presence of powerful vintage staples like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Black Lotus allows the player to gain significant advantages and close out the game quickly if given the opportunity. The deck aims to play a proactive control game, while utilizing the graveyard with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Nihil Spellbomb.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and establish a strong board presence with artifact creatures and powerful artifacts. By utilizing cards like Moxen, Grim Monolith, and Mishra's Workshop, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production and cast powerful threats such as Tezzeret, Karn, and Mystic Forge. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Pithing Needle helps to disrupt opponents' strategies and control the game. The deck's ability to quickly generate mana and deploy threatening artifacts makes it a formidable Aggro-MUD archetype in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to maintain control of the board while digging for key cards. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion. With access to disruptive spells like Strip Mine and Wasteland, along with versatile threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes card draw spells and cantrips to maintain card advantage and dig for key pieces. Additionally, Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recur low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to out-value and out-manuever the opponent through efficient card selection and powerful interactions.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies with hate cards like Void Mirror and Archon of Emeria, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer. The deck aims to control the game by denying the opponent resources with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine, while also leveraging powerful mana acceleration from the Moxen and Ancient Tomb. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of disruptive creatures and efficient threats, ultimately securing victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using artifacts like Moxes and Grim Monolith, allowing you to cast powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck also utilizes key artifacts like Time Vault and The One Ring to create explosive plays and close out the game swiftly. Utilizing powerful lands like Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts.

This deck aims to quickly deploy powerful artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and disruptive cards. By utilizing fast mana sources like the Moxen and artifacts such as Mana Crypt and Sol Ring, as well as the ability to untap artifacts with cards like Manifold Key and Grim Monolith, the deck can establish a strong board presence early on. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Trinisphere provide additional disruption for the opponent, while powerful creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Patchwork Automaton can quickly end the game.

This deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for repeated value from the graveyard. The deck also leverages powerful mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to cast spells ahead of curve. With a focus on tempo and card advantage, this Aggro-Fish archetype aims to outmaneuver the opponent and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells and disruptive creatures to control the game and limit the opponent's options, while also maintaining a strong aggressive presence. By combining efficient removal spells, counterspells, and mana denial with threats like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with its own creatures and powerful spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience, allowing the deck to grind out wins in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, allowing you to constantly bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, you can combo off quickly and overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection for your key pieces, while Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul offer additional reach and value in the late game. Overall, the deck aims to set up explosive plays and outpace your opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while also utilizing powerful artifacts and spells to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Gifts Ungiven allows the player to search for specific cards to set up powerful combos and win conditions. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while assembling its own win condition, whether through overwhelming card advantage, storming off with Brain Freeze, or utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value and recursion.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful artifacts like Mana Vault, Time Vault, and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It leverages cards like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Tinker to find key pieces quickly, while also using counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its game plan. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Bolas's Citadel provide additional win conditions, and the deck's setup allows for card advantage and manipulation to stay ahead of opponents. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the game through precise control and powerful artifact synergies.

This deck is focused on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The use of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring cheap permanents from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes powerful draw spells like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Dig Through Time to ensure consistency and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents with its control elements and powerful card selection tools.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Chancellor of the Annex, and Archon of Emeria, you can slow down your opponent's spells and make it difficult for them to establish a board presence. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer to provide a solid aggressive strategy. With mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, you can quickly deploy your threats and control the game.
